Explanation: This sets the activity's layout to the specified layout file. In this case, we're setting the layout to the main activity layout file.

Next, we would need to create a GridView or a TableLayout to display the matrix. Here's an example of how you could do this using a GridView:

```java
GridView gridView = new GridView(this);
gridView.setNumColumns(w); // Set the number of columns in the grid view
gridView.setAdapter(new BaseAdapter() {
    @Override
    public int getCount() {
        return h * w; // The total number of items in the grid view
    }

    @Override
    public Object getItem(int position) {
        return null;
    }

    @Override

        return 0;

    @Override
    public View getView(int position, View convertView, ViewGroup parent) {
        TextView textView = new TextView(MainActivity.this);
        textView.setLayoutParams(new GridView.LayoutParams(80, 80)); // Set the size of each item in the grid view
        textView.setGravity(Gravity.CENTER); // Center the text in each item
        return textView;
    }
});

setContentView(gridView); // Set the grid view as the content view
```
